meanings.definition: To sell more of (a stock or product) than can be supplied.
meanings.sent1: The store oversold the popular toy, causing many disappointed customers.
meanings.sent2: The company oversold their new product, leading to delays in delivery.
meanings.sent3: The salesman oversold the benefits of the vacuum cleaner, claiming it could do magic tricks.
meanings.sent4: The auctioneer oversold the painting, describing it as a masterpiece when it was just a doodle.
meanings.sent5: The marketing team oversold the event, promising celebrities and fireworks but delivering a simple gathering.

meanings.definition: To present or describe (something) as being better or more successful than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent oversold the small house, calling it a mansion to attract buyers.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement oversold the benefits of the shampoo, claiming it could make hair grow overnight.
meanings.sent3: The chef oversold the soup, saying it had magical powers to cure all ailments.
meanings.sent4: The author oversold the book, describing it as a literary masterpiece when it was just a simple story.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide oversold the historical site, making it sound like a place of mythical legends.
